comments:
Using Sleak, seems that everytime Java perspective is closed/opened, 5 new Image
handles are leaked. I was using M4. All seemed to have similar, following stack
trace (from Sleak). 

java.lang.Error
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.new_Object(Device.java:682)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.<init>(Image.java:594)
	at org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor.createImage(ImageDescriptor.java:186)

There are multiple views that are not calling super.dispose() which is not
allowing WorkbenchPart.dispose() to do its magic.

The 2 views that I found are SourceView and TableView (ProblemView).
David, could you tell me if you see this problem on 3.1?

It looks fine now. I just checked 3.1.1 "RC1" and all seemed to maintain same
total number. (21 "came and went" when swithing perspecives, ... total number
(97) stayed the same .... having all perspectives closed and then open java's
uses 86 images, but all correctly disposed and recreated when opened/closed) --
at least, according to sleak :)
